 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָשַׁל‎</span>] **verb** ==represent, be like== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***stand erect*** (compare [[BDB#Fl|Fl]]<sup>De [[Prov.1.1|Prov 1:1]]</sup>), II. ***effigiavit, representavit*** (rem alicui), see ***imitate, use a verse as a poverb***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***description by way of comparison***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***mašâlu***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 451 f.</sup>; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***become like***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מְתַל‎</span> ***be like***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***compare***). **Niph\`al** ***Perfect***3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְשַׁל‎</span> [[Ps.49.13|Ps 49:13]]; [[Ps.49.21|Ps 49:21]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְֹשָׁ֑לְתָּ‎</span> [[Isa.14.10|Isa 14:10]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִמְשַׁלְתִּי‎</span> [[Ps.28.1|Ps 28:1]]; [[Ps.143.7|Ps 143:7]]: — ***be like, similar***, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> [[Isa.14.10|Isa 14:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִם‎</span> [[Ps.28.1|Ps 28:1]] = [[Ps.143.7|Ps 143:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּ‎</span> [[Ps.49.13|Ps 49:13]]; [[Ps.49.21|Ps 49:21]]. **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** 2 masculine plural suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְתָמְשִׁלוּנִי‎</span> ***compare*** [[Isa.46.5|Isa 46:5]]. **Hithpa\`el** ***Imperfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וָאֶתְמַשֵּׁל‎</span> [[Job.30.19|Job 30:19]] (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּ‎</span>) ***and I have become like dust.***. 

 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָשַׁל‎</span> **verb denominative** ==use of proverb, speak in parables or sentences of poetry==, especially Ezekiel; — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִמְשֹׁל‎</span> [[Ezek.16.44|Ezek 16:44]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִמְשְׁלוּ‎</span> [[Ezek.12.23|Ezek 12:23]] ***Imperative*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְשֹׁל‎</span> [[Ezek.17.2|Ezek 17:2]]; [[Ezek.24.3|Ezek 24:3]] ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְשֹׁל‎</span> [[Ezek.18.3|Ezek 18:3]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎משֵׁל‎</span> [[Ezek.16.44|Ezek 16:44]], plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎משְׁלִים‎</span> [[Ezek.18.2|Ezek 18:2]]; [[Num.21.27|Num 21:27]] — ***use a proverb:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָשָׁל‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Ezek.12.23|Ezek 12:23]]; [[Ezek.18.3|Ezek 18:3]] a parable with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> [[Ezek.17.2|Ezek 17:2]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חוּד חִידָה‎</span>), [[Ezek.24.3|Ezek 24:3]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלֿ‎</span> [[Ezek.18.2|Ezek 18:2]], and (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָשָׁל‎</span> apparently omitted) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנֵּה כָּלֿ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמּשֵׁל עָלַיִךְ יִמְשֹׁל‎</span> [[Ezek.16.44|Ezek 16:44]] (but this is awkward; point <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנֵּה כֹּל הַמָּשָׁל‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎משְׁלִים‎</span> [[Num.21.27|Num 21:27]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]])., **Pi\`el** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲלֹא מְמַשֵּׁל מְשָׁלִים הוּא‎</span> [[Ezek.21.5|Ezek 21:5]] ***is he not a maker of parables?***
